citeinfo.origin: Wildland Resource Enterprises and Redwood Science Laboratory, U.S. Forest Service California, and the National Biological Service, Alaska.
citeinfo.title: Marbled and Kittlitze Murrelet Survey's

descript.abstract: Data Type: Birds; A cooperative effort between Michael McAllister, Wildland Resource Enterprises, C.J. Ralph, US Forest Service Redwood Science Laboratory, Arcada, CA. and John Piatt, National Biological Service, Anchorage, Alaska. Transects were recorded from the bridge of a 58 foot Seine Vessel while traveling between and during salmon and herring fisheries: Alexander Archipelago, Prince William Sound, Kenai Peninsula, Alaska Peninsula, and Bristol Bay. The majority of transects are near shore regions of the Gulf of Alaska. Absolute counts, behavior, flyways, fishholding, fledged young, and molt data are recorded throughout surveys. Additional relative distribution records were recorded for all bird species and migratory counts. The most extensive records are from northern Southeast Alaska. Latitude and Longitudes were recorded on NOAA National Ocean Service Charts.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
